dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1056 IH: To include the Czech Republic in the list of foreign states whose nationals are eligible for admission into the United States as E1 nonimmigrants if United States nationals are treated similarly by the Government of the Czech Republic.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cohen (for himself, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Doggett, Mr. Gooden, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Keating, Mr. Garbarino, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Goldman of New York, Mr. Carter of Texas, Mr. Larson of Connecticut, Mr. Suozzi, and Ms. Ross) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To include the Czech Republic in the list of foreign states whose nationals are eligible for admission into the United States as E1 nonimmigrants if United States nationals are treated similarly by the Government of the Czech Republic.

section.text: For purposes of section 101(a)(15)(E)(i) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(E)(i)), the Czech Republic shall be considered to be a foreign state described in such section if the Government of the Czech Republic provides similar nonimmigrant status to nationals of the United States.
